1.title: Livin' the Dream
1.plot: The residents of apartment 212, Chloe, Matthew, and Brian are going about their usual mornings. Chloe's sister, Laura, swings in for her typical fly-by meal, and their neighbor Jess stops by as well. Jess introduces them to her new roommate.

2.title: Who Said Agents Don't Kill
2.plot: Jess and Sugar find that rooming together might have its difficulties. Chloe faces one of her worst nightmares when she finds out her agency has dropped her. Jess tries to comfort her.

3.title: Brains, Anyone?
3.plot: Matthew comes home from a long day of work including an unexpected visit from his obsessive admirer, Dori. Matthew vents to Brian, who was enjoying a fun zombie flick. When Matthew heads to bed, he has no idea whats in store.

4.title: A Teaspoon of Sugar
4.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Holiday Spirit
5.plot: Matthew finally unloads his feelings of Dori while Jess gets ready to celebrate her favorite holiday of the year. With a Christmas party that doesn't quite go as planned, emotions run high, but in the end Jess gets what she's been hoping for.

locations: Los Angeles, California, USA::(interiors of Apartment Complex)
imdb.plot outline: Marbles focuses on a group of friends in their mid-twenties who are living in Los Angeles, CA. It focuses on their relationships with each other and the various events they encounter. Similar to many sitcoms and series one can see on TV. The main difference with Marbles is that the audience will get to go inside someone's mind for each episode to see how they're viewing the world around them. The audience will get to see the character's inner monologue come to life. In doing so, the possibilities are endless as to what could show up on the screen.
imdb.title: Marbles
plot: _Marbles_ (qv) focuses on a group of friends in their mid-twenties who are living in Los Angeles, CA. It focuses on their relationships with each other and the various events they encounter. Similar to many sitcoms and series one can see on TV. The main difference with _Marbles_ (qv) is that the audience will get to go inside someone's mind for each episode to see how they're viewing the world around them. The audience will get to see the character's inner monologue come to life. In doing so, the possibilities are endless as to what could show up on the screen.::Sara Stollberger
